{{lead too short|date=October 2012}}
 
{{lead too short|date=October 2012}}
    −
'''Ethics''', also known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending concepts of right and wrong behavior.<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> It comes from the Greek word [[ethos]], which means "character".
+
'''Ethics''', also known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending concepts of right and wrong conduct.<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> It comes from the Greek word [[ethos]], which means "character".
    −
Major areas of study in ethics may be divided into 3 operational areas:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
+
Major areas of study in ethics may be divided into 4 operational areas:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Normative ethics]], about the practical means of determining a moral course of action;
 
* [[Normative ethics]], about the practical means of determining a moral course of action;
  +
* [[Descriptive ethics]], also known as comparative ethics, is the study of people's beliefs about morality;
 
* [[Applied ethics]], about how moral outcomes can be achieved in specific situations;
 
* [[Applied ethics]], about how moral outcomes can be achieved in specific situations;
